channel.title: Starting a rsc server
channel.description: Hey, I'm new to this forum and new to Runescape classic servers. Me and my friend started playing them a lot and we want to set one up but were not sure where to start. I have tried to look up tutorials but cant find any good ones. Any help and info on starting a Runescape classic server would be much appreciated.

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @potential_kilo potential kilo
item.description:
@potential_kilo wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:11, topic:537574”]Why not be a player instead of a game operator? Everybody and his dog seems to want to operate a server but very few (and definitely no dogs yet) are prepared to put the time into learning how to write software and administrate a server.
Worse still, it dilutes the player base each time a short-lived server enters the scene and then crashes and burns.

I hate to break it to you but, all things considered (the considerable learning curve in particular if you expect to competently overcome the inevitable problems like software bugs), you’d probably have more fun just being a regular player.[/quote]
I would say fiddle around with what you want and be a player. There is never no harm in learning, plus you could potentially go far!

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Why not be a player instead of a game operator? Everybody and his dog seems to want to operate a server but very few (and definitely no dogs yet) are prepared to put the time into learning how to write software and administrate a server.
Worse still, it dilutes the player base each time a short-lived server enters the scene and then crashes and burns.

I hate to break it to you but, all things considered (the considerable learning curve in particular if you expect to competently overcome the inevitable problems like software bugs), you’d probably have more fun just being a regular player.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

coffee420:

I ran the “run server” and it loaded fine and i ran the “run client” but when i go to log in it says sorry unable to connect. Also how do i change the name of the client from NOOBscape to a name i choose? And is there any other software i need to run this server?

When you click on run client u also need to run the server when the gui pops up, also go here for alot of help with this http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,363007.0.html. Most stuff can be found via the search bar too

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @coffee420 coffee420
item.description:

I ran the “run server” and it loaded fine and i ran the “run client” but when i go to log in it says sorry unable to connect. Also how do i change the name of the client from NOOBscape to a name i choose? And is there any other software i need to run this server?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

coffee420:

I have been trying to use it but i can’t figure out how to set it up properly.

all u have to do is click on runserver in server folder, then go to client folder and click on rune client and just use any username and password and bam ur online. you could also check out my work in progress in my signature if you would like.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

coffee420:

Thanks. Also i looked at that easyrsc thing but the download is gone when i click it. Also i found something called NOOBScape. I just started checking it out and i’m not sure how to get it set up so far. Is it a good server to start with?

Yes it is the same as easyrsc(xEnts), but Yong Min has added onto it.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

no problem bro if you are looking to start coding you must start somewhere. This would be your best option to start with http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,340170.0.html.

There are two kinds of server you can have and they are database and text file. The link above is a text file based server that is alot easier to figure out when you are new. Once you Progress i would definitely look into a database server as you can do much more with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @coffee420 coffee420
item.description:
@coffee420 wrote:

Thanks for the quick reply. Also where should i start looking for some good, informative tutorials? I’m not even sure what the first step i should take towards making a server is. Should i start with getting a source and client?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a rsc server
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

that is great that you have an interest in RSC, we definantly could use some more people in the scene There is plenty of tutorials around right in this forum… test some of them out and if you run into problem then post em here for help… i have been through some stuff i may be able to help you along with.

Read full topic
